go_data.justification: Cathepsin D is synthesized as a 53-kD precursor, which is processed into a 47-kD intermediate form in endocytic compartments and ultimately transported to lysosomes.
Cathepsin D is processed from a 53-kD precursor to a 47-kD intermediate form in endocytic compartments.
Cathepsin D is transported through early endosomes en route to lysosomes.
Cathepsin D is a lysosomal aspartic protease, implying peptidase activity.
